wikipedia_page.main: John William Lee (1 February 1902 – 20 June 1944), generally known as Jack Lee, was an English cricketer who played for Somerset from 1925 to 1936, having played one match for Middlesex in 1923.  He was an all-rounder, scoring six centuries and taking ten wickets in a match on two occasions by the end of his career.  He was killed on active service with the British Army during the Second World War.
